metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14340 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was discovered in XNIO where file descriptor leak caused by growing amounts of NIO Selector file handles between garbage collection cycles. It may allow the attacker to cause a denial of service. It affects XNIO versions 3.6.0.Beta1 through 3.8.1.Final.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjboss-xnio-java - 3.8.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jboss-xnio package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1').
